allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

___usage.description: A detailed description of how the asset is used from a clinical perspective.

___library.description: A reference to a Library resource containing any formal logic used by the plan definition.

___status.description: The status of this plan definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

___type.description: The type of asset the plan definition represents, e.g. an order set, protocol, or event-condition-action rule.

___title.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the plan definition.

___publisher.description: The name of the individual or organization that published the plan definition.

___description.description: A free text natural language description of the plan definition from a consumer's perspective.

___effectivePeriod.description: The period during which the plan definition content was or is planned to be in active use.

___version.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the plan definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the plan definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.

___url.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this plan definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this plan definition is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the plan definition. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).

___useContext.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate plan definition instances.

___lastReviewDate.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval, but doesn't change the original approval date.

___identifier.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this plan definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

___date.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the plan definition was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the plan definition changes.

___experimental.description: A boolean value to indicate that this plan definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

___contributor.description: A contributor to the content of the asset, including authors, editors, reviewers, and endorsers.

___jurisdiction.description: A legal or geographic region in which the plan definition is intended to be used.

___action.description: An action to be taken as part of the plan.

___topic.description: Descriptive topics related to the content of the plan definition. Topics provide a high-level categorization of the definition that can be useful for filtering and searching.

___goal.description: Goals that describe what the activities within the plan are intended to achieve. For example, weight loss, restoring an activity of daily living, obtaining herd immunity via immunization, meeting a process improvement objective, etc.

___contact.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

___purpose.description: Explaination of why this plan definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

___name.description: A natural language name identifying the plan definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

___relatedArtifact.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

___copyright.description: A copyright statement relating to the plan definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the plan definition.

___approvalDate.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

description: see http://hl7.org/fhir/json.html#schema for information about the FHIR Json Schemas

allOf.description: Base definition for all elements that are defined inside a resource - but not those in a data type.

___modifierExtension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.
A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

___start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

___end.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

___timingPeriod.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

allOf.description: Specifies an event that may occur multiple times. Timing schedules are used to record when things are planned, expected or requested to occur. The most common usage is in dosage instructions for medications. They are also used when planning care of various kinds, and may be used for reporting the schedule to which past regular activities were carried out.

___event.description: Identifies specific times when the event occurs.

___code.description: A code for the timing schedule. Some codes such as BID are ubiquitous, but many institutions define their own additional codes. If a code is provided, the code is understood to be a complete statement of whatever is specified in the structured timing data, and either the code or the data may be used to interpret the Timing, with the exception that .repeat.bounds still applies over the code (and is not contained in the code).

___repeat.description: A set of rules that describe when the event is scheduled.

___timingTiming.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

___participant.description: Indicates who should participate in performing the action described.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

___type.description: The type of participant in the action.

___role.description: The role the participant should play in performing the described action.

allOf.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___version.description: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

___code.description: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).

___display.description: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.

___userSelected.description: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).

___system.description: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.

___type.description: The type of action to perform (create, update, remove).

allOf.description: A length of time.

___timingDuration.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

allOf.description: A reference from one resource to another.

___display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

___identifier.description: An identifier for the other resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

___reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

___transform.description: A reference to a StructureMap resource that defines a transform that can be executed to produce the intent resource using the ActivityDefinition instance as the input.

___condition.description: An expression that describes applicability criteria, or start/stop conditions for the action.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

___language.description: The media type of the language for the expression.

___expression.description: An expression that returns true or false, indicating whether or not the condition is satisfied.

___description.description: A brief, natural language description of the condition that effectively communicates the intended semantics.

___title.description: The title of the action displayed to a user.

___dynamicValue.description: Customizations that should be applied to the statically defined resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a customization would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the resource that would contain the result.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

___language.description: The media type of the language for the expression.

___expression.description: An expression specifying the value of the customized element.

___description.description: A brief, natural language description of the intended semantics of the dynamic value.

___path.description: The path to the element to be customized. This is the path on the resource that will hold the result of the calculation defined by the expression.

allOf.description: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

___low.description: The low limit. The boundary is inclusive.

___high.description: The high limit. The boundary is inclusive.

___timingRange.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

___description.description: A short description of the action used to provide a summary to display to the user.

___relatedAction.description: A relationship to another action such as "before" or "30-60 minutes after start of".

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

___offsetRange.description: A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

___offsetDuration.description: A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

___relationship.description: The relationship of this action to the related action.

___actionId.description: The element id of the related action.

___timingDateTime.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

___cardinalityBehavior.description: Defines whether the action can be selected multiple times.

___requiredBehavior.description: Defines the requiredness behavior for the action.

___triggerDefinition.description: A description of when the action should be triggered.

allOf.description: A description of a triggering event.

___eventTimingTiming.description: The timing of the event (if this is a period trigger).

___eventData.description: The triggering data of the event (if this is a data trigger).

___eventTimingDate.description: The timing of the event (if this is a period trigger).

___eventTimingDateTime.description: The timing of the event (if this is a period trigger).

___eventTimingReference.description: The timing of the event (if this is a period trigger).

___eventName.description: The name of the event (if this is a named-event trigger).

___code.description: A code that provides meaning for the action or action group. For example, a section may have a LOINC code for a the section of a documentation template.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___textEquivalent.description: A text equivalent of the action to be performed. This provides a human-interpretable description of the action when the definition is consumed by a system that may not be capable of interpreting it dynamically.

___precheckBehavior.description: Defines whether the action should usually be preselected.

___reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. ___definition.description: A reference to an ActivityDefinition that describes the action to be taken in detail, or a PlanDefinition that describes a series of actions to be taken.

___action.description: Sub actions that are contained within the action. The behavior of this action determines the functionality of the sub-actions. For example, a selection behavior of at-most-one indicates that of the sub-actions, at most one may be chosen as part of realizing the action definition.

___documentation.description: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the action that can be provided to the CDS recipient. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

___selectionBehavior.description: Defines the selection behavior for the action and its children.

___reason.description: A description of why this action is necessary or appropriate.

___groupingBehavior.description: Defines the grouping behavior for the action and its children.

___label.description: A user-visible label for the action.

___output.description: Defines the outputs of the action, if any.

___goalId.description: Identifies goals that this action supports. The reference must be to a goal element defined within this plan definition.

___input.description: Defines input data requirements for the action.

___type.description: The type of relationship to the related artifact.

___url.description: A url for the artifact that can be followed to access the actual content.

___display.description: A brief description of the document or knowledge resource being referenced, suitable for display to a consumer.

___document.description: The document being referenced, represented as an attachment. This is exclusive with the resource element.

allOf.description: Describes a required data item for evaluation in terms of the type of data, and optional code or date-based filters of the data.

___codeFilter.description: Code filters specify additional constraints on the data, specifying the value set of interest for a particular element of the data.

___type.description: The type of the required data, specified as the type name of a resource. For profiles, this value is set to the type of the base resource of the profile.

___dateFilter.description: Date filters specify additional constraints on the data in terms of the applicable date range for specific elements.

___mustSupport.description: Indicates that specific elements of the type are referenced by the knowledge module and must be supported by the consumer in order to obtain an effective evaluation. This does not mean that a value is required for this element, only that the consuming system must understand the element and be able to provide values for it if they are available. Note that the value for this element can be a path to allow references to nested elements. In that case, all the elements along the path must be supported.

___profile.description: The profile of the required data, specified as the uri of the profile definition.

___goalId.description: Identifies goals that this action supports. The reference must be to a goal element defined within this plan definition.

___input.description: Defines input data requirements for the action.

___documentation.description: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the goal that provide further supporting information about the goal. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___description.description: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".

___target.description: Indicates what should be done and within what timeframe.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

___detailRange.description: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. Whan a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.

___detailCodeableConcept.description: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. Whan a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.

___due.description: Indicates the timeframe after the start of the goal in which the goal should be met.

___detailQuantity.description: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. Whan a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.

___measure.description: The parameter whose value is to be tracked, e.g. body weigth, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___start.description: The event after which the goal should begin being pursued.

___category.description: Indicates a category the goal falls within.

___priority.description: Identifies the expected level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the defined goal.

___addresses.description: Identifies problems, conditions, issues, or concerns the goal is intended to address.

___text.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

___contained.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

___extension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

___usage.description: A detailed description of how the asset is used from a clinical perspective.

___library.description: A reference to a Library resource containing any formal logic used by the plan definition.

allOf.description: A reference from one resource to another.

___display.description: Plain text narrative that identifies the resource in addition to the resource reference.

___identifier.description: An identifier for the other resource. This is used when there is no way to reference the other resource directly, either because the entity is not available through a FHIR server, or because there is no way for the author of the resource to convert a known identifier to an actual location. There is no requirement that a Reference.identifier point to something that is actually exposed as a FHIR instance, but it SHALL point to a business concept that would be expected to be exposed as a FHIR instance, and that instance would need to be of a FHIR resource type allowed by the reference.

___reference.description: A reference to a location at which the other resource is found. The reference may be a relative reference, in which case it is relative to the service base URL, or an absolute URL that resolves to the location where the resource is found. The reference may be version specific or not. If the reference is not to a FHIR RESTful server, then it should be assumed to be version specific. Internal fragment references (start with '#') refer to contained resources.

___status.description: The status of this plan definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___type.description: The type of asset the plan definition represents, e.g. an order set, protocol, or event-condition-action rule.

___title.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the plan definition.

___publisher.description: The name of the individual or organization that published the plan definition.

___description.description: A free text natural language description of the plan definition from a consumer's perspective.

allOf.description: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

___start.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

___end.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.

___effectivePeriod.description: The period during which the plan definition content was or is planned to be in active use.

___version.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the plan definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the plan definition author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.

___url.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this plan definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this plan definition is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the plan definition. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).

___useContext.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate plan definition instances.

allOf.description: Specifies clinical/business/etc metadata that can be used to retrieve, index and/or categorize an artifact. This metadata can either be specific to the applicable population (e.g., age category, DRG) or the specific context of care (e.g., venue, care setting, provider of care).

___valueCodeableConcept.description: A value that defines the context specified in this context of use. The interpretation of the value is defined by the code.

___valueQuantity.description: A value that defines the context specified in this context of use. The interpretation of the value is defined by the code.

___code.description: A code that identifies the type of context being specified by this usage context.

___valueRange.description: A value that defines the context specified in this context of use. The interpretation of the value is defined by the code.

___lastReviewDate.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval, but doesn't change the original approval date.

___identifier.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this plan definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

allOf.description: A technical identifier - identifies some entity uniquely and unambiguously.

___type.description: A coded type for the identifier that can be used to determine which identifier to use for a specific purpose.

___period.description: Time period during which identifier is/was valid for use.

___value.description: The portion of the identifier typically relevant to the user and which is unique within the context of the system.

___system.description: Establishes the namespace for the value - that is, a URL that describes a set values that are unique.

___date.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the plan definition was published. The date must change if and when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the plan definition changes.

___experimental.description: A boolean value to indicate that this plan definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

___contributor.description: A contributor to the content of the asset, including authors, editors, reviewers, and endorsers.

allOf.description: A contributor to the content of a knowledge asset, including authors, editors, reviewers, and endorsers.

___name.description: The name of the individual or organization responsible for the contribution.

___contact.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the contributor.

___jurisdiction.description: A legal or geographic region in which the plan definition is intended to be used.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___action.description: An action to be taken as part of the plan.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

___timingPeriod.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

___timingTiming.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

___participant.description: Indicates who should participate in performing the action described.

___type.description: The type of action to perform (create, update, remove).

___timingDuration.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

___transform.description: A reference to a StructureMap resource that defines a transform that can be executed to produce the intent resource using the ActivityDefinition instance as the input.

___condition.description: An expression that describes applicability criteria, or start/stop conditions for the action.

___title.description: The title of the action displayed to a user.

___dynamicValue.description: Customizations that should be applied to the statically defined resource. For example, if the dosage of a medication must be computed based on the patient's weight, a customization would be used to specify an expression that calculated the weight, and the path on the resource that would contain the result.

___timingRange.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

___description.description: A short description of the action used to provide a summary to display to the user.

___relatedAction.description: A relationship to another action such as "before" or "30-60 minutes after start of".

___timingDateTime.description: An optional value describing when the action should be performed.

___cardinalityBehavior.description: Defines whether the action can be selected multiple times.

___requiredBehavior.description: Defines the requiredness behavior for the action.

___triggerDefinition.description: A description of when the action should be triggered.

___code.description: A code that provides meaning for the action or action group. For example, a section may have a LOINC code for a the section of a documentation template.

___textEquivalent.description: A text equivalent of the action to be performed. This provides a human-interpretable description of the action when the definition is consumed by a system that may not be capable of interpreting it dynamically.

___precheckBehavior.description: Defines whether the action should usually be preselected.

___definition.description: A reference to an ActivityDefinition that describes the action to be taken in detail, or a PlanDefinition that describes a series of actions to be taken.

___action.description: Sub actions that are contained within the action. The behavior of this action determines the functionality of the sub-actions. For example, a selection behavior of at-most-one indicates that of the sub-actions, at most one may be chosen as part of realizing the action definition.

___documentation.description: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the action that can be provided to the CDS recipient. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

___selectionBehavior.description: Defines the selection behavior for the action and its children.

___reason.description: A description of why this action is necessary or appropriate.

___groupingBehavior.description: Defines the grouping behavior for the action and its children.

___label.description: A user-visible label for the action.

___output.description: Defines the outputs of the action, if any.

___goalId.description: Identifies goals that this action supports. The reference must be to a goal element defined within this plan definition.

___input.description: Defines input data requirements for the action.

___topic.description: Descriptive topics related to the content of the plan definition. Topics provide a high-level categorization of the definition that can be useful for filtering and searching.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___goal.description: Goals that describe what the activities within the plan are intended to achieve. For example, weight loss, restoring an activity of daily living, obtaining herd immunity via immunization, meeting a process improvement objective, etc.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.

___documentation.description: Didactic or other informational resources associated with the goal that provide further supporting information about the goal. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.

___description.description: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".

___target.description: Indicates what should be done and within what timeframe.

___start.description: The event after which the goal should begin being pursued.

___category.description: Indicates a category the goal falls within.

___priority.description: Identifies the expected level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the defined goal.

___addresses.description: Identifies problems, conditions, issues, or concerns the goal is intended to address.

___contact.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

allOf.description: Specifies contact information for a person or organization.

___name.description: The name of an individual to contact.

___telecom.description: The contact details for the individual (if a name was provided) or the organization.

___purpose.description: Explaination of why this plan definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

___name.description: A natural language name identifying the plan definition. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

___relatedArtifact.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

allOf.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

___citation.description: A bibliographic citation for the related artifact. This text SHOULD be formatted according to an accepted citation format.

___type.description: The type of relationship to the related artifact.

___url.description: A url for the artifact that can be followed to access the actual content.

___display.description: A brief description of the document or knowledge resource being referenced, suitable for display to a consumer.

___document.description: The document being referenced, represented as an attachment. This is exclusive with the resource element.

___resource.description: The related resource, such as a library, value set, profile, or other knowledge resource.

___copyright.description: A copyright statement relating to the plan definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the plan definition.

___approvalDate.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

allOf.description: Base definition for all elements that are defined inside a resource - but not those in a data type.

___modifierExtension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.
A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

___low.description: The low limit. The boundary is inclusive.

___high.description: The high limit. The boundary is inclusive.

___offsetRange.description: A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

allOf.description: A length of time.

___offsetDuration.description: A duration or range of durations to apply to the relationship. For example, 30-60 minutes before.

___relationship.description: The relationship of this action to the related action.

___actionId.description: The element id of the related action.

allOf.description: Base definition for all elements that are defined inside a resource - but not those in a data type.

___modifierExtension.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

allOf.description: This resource allows for the definition of various types of plans as a sharable, consumable, and executable artifact. The resource is general enough to support the description of a broad range of clinical artifacts such as clinical decision support rules, order sets and protocols.
A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

___low.description: The low limit. The boundary is inclusive.

___high.description: The high limit. The boundary is inclusive.

___detailRange.description: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. Whan a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___detailCodeableConcept.description: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. Whan a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.

allOf.description: A length of time.

___due.description: Indicates the timeframe after the start of the goal in which the goal should be met.

allOf.description: A measured amount (or an amount that can potentially be measured). Note that measured amounts include amounts that are not precisely quantified, including amounts involving arbitrary units and floating currencies.

___comparator.description: How the value should be understood and represented - whether the actual value is greater or less than the stated value due to measurement issues; e.g. if the comparator is "<" , then the real value is < stated value.

___code.description: A computer processable form of the unit in some unit representation system.

___value.description: The value of the measured amount. The value includes an implicit precision in the presentation of the value.

___unit.description: A human-readable form of the unit.

___system.description: The identification of the system that provides the coded form of the unit.

___detailQuantity.description: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. Whan a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.

allOf.description: A concept that may be defined by a formal reference to a terminology or ontology or may be provided by text.

___text.description: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.

___coding.description: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.

___measure.description: The parameter whose value is to be tracked, e.g. body weigth, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.
